openai.AuthenticationError: .. {"message":"Incorrect API key provided: you

That means FastAPI is still picking up the placeholder string your_api_key instead of the
secret you just pasted.
Let's wipe the placeholder and be 100 % sure the real key is loaded.

1 — Remove / override the bad value

A. Make sure no shell variable is set
bash Y Copied
echo $O0PENAI_API_KEY

If it prints your_api_key (or anything at all):
bash O) Copy
unset OPENAI_API_KEY

B. Ensure only the real key exists in files

* .env > has the one true key (already done).

+ .env.sample - delete or rename it so python-dotenv can’t load the placeholder: |

bash O) Copy
